dt: {bc}to estimate (something) roughly or casually {bc}to give a {d_link|ballpark|ballpark:2} estimate of (something, such as a number or price)

dt.t: The track doesn't release attendance numbers, but media members {wi}ballparked{/wi} it at 42,500 in the facility, which seats more than 50,000.
When I work with clients I remind them that we are just {wi}ballparking{/wi} the numbers.
He looked at the ceiling. He looked at the walls. He turned this way and that, craning his neck, like a contractor about to {wi}ballpark{/wi} an estimate.

shortdef: to estimate (something) roughly or casually : to give a ballpark estimate of (something, such as a number or price)

dt: {bc}a park or stadium in which ball games (such as baseball) are played
{bc}a range (as of prices or views) within which comparison or compromise is possible

dt.t: my first guess wasn't even {it}in the ballpark{/it}

shortdef: a park or stadium in which ball games (such as baseball) are played
a range (as of prices or views) within which comparison or compromise is possible
